fol.836r
A l
re
to M
r
Wilkes and M
r
Bodley emploied at this
present in
her Ma
t
s
rvice w
th
the
estates generall
of the
Unyted Provinces
. That they should understand that
before theire L
re
s ca
m
to there LLs: w
th
those from the
estates generall and of
Holland
and
Zeland
bothe to her
Ma
tie
and there LLs: they had given order by her Ma
t
com-
maundem
t
that those
m
chaunt
of the
Lowe Countryes
and
e
masters and marryners here whose shippes were taken and
staied on the Seas co
m
ing out of
Spaune
by
S
r
John
Hawkins
and
S
r
Martin Frobusher
knights should make
attestac
o
n before the Judge of the Admyralltie to whome
the goodes and
m
chaundize did belonge and thereuppon put
resturac
o
n to be made unto them of the shippes &
m
chaundize
putting in Baund
to make resturac
o
n of the value of so
moche as uppon due proofe shuld fall out
to
ap
taune to
Spanyardes, w
ch
her Ma
tie
was pleased shuld p
n
tlie be ex-
ecuted althoughe the said gen
t
had wrytten
to her
hether
very confidentlie that yt would be proved the good
in
those shippes did ap
taune unto Spanyard
and to be cullored
by those of that Natyon Therefore they might assure as well
the estates generall, as those of Holland and Zeland that
there was no meaninge in her Ma
tie
to impeache anie way theire
Traffick so as the same be of meere
m
chaundize howebeit
her Ma
tie
was certaunelie advertized that under the pretence of
m
chaundize there were amongst them
t
did convey munytion
&
vic
o
n of warr unto Spaine as there were div ers lykewyse
t
cullored the good
of Spanyard
in theire Intercourse of traficke
Therefore as her Ma
tie
had a care that they shuld not be lett and
interrupted in there traffick, So they were to require them
t
better Regard hereafter might to used that these abuses were
not commytted whereby the com
o
n Ennemy might be supplied
of munytion & ther necessary
vic
o
n to mayntaune the warres
against her Ma
tie
./
